channel.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
channel.description: In 20 years do you thing we will still be around? If it is will you still be around? If it dies will you remember it?

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Have you heard of Second Life?
There are virtual reality addons for it that make it realistic [eg pedal a bike and things, vr920 act’s as a stereoscopic headset too, I believe.]

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Holy shit. If the internet was virtual reality, we wouldn’t have a forums. We would just meet up and talk to each other and discuss. It would change the internet forever; turning everything alive. Then runescape will actually take skill to play. Hah, by the time that comes out I’ll be way outdated with technology.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:61, topic:186942”][quote author=cooper link=topic=249474.msg2151102#msg2151102 date=1207024511]
Not necessarily, and also there might be virtual reality browsers that let you step into the web [well better versions of the one already out at least]! But, I’m pretty sure normal cars/web browsers will still be used.
[/quote]
I don’t want virtual reality browsers, if I want to check Moparisthebest it easiest is to click a bookmark, don’t go there in virtual realty.
Of course the browser get better, but don’t VR.[/quote]
I’m sure there would still be ways to get there without VR, but I really can’t wait for VR to be more mainstream, I’ve already saved up enough for a VR920 and I want a CAVE

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

xxlegitxx:

You’re retarded.

wo ai ni!

yes about portable flying machine I got a basic idea on how to build on a 200$ budget.

Take a moped engine 50CC those 2 2 stroke engine or so the regular ones.
Buy 2x propellers dunno some lightweight ones get a gear box that spins each propeller in oppsite direction from each other which will give it some lift.

Hell if it doesn’t make you fly you got your self a good pogostick!, glider, mini parachute whatever!

and yah… the way the world is advancing its all from ideas of the future LCD screens etc… all the movies you see will soon be a reality due to the mentel visions everyone has and makes the movies etc… so yes it’s gonna happen 20 years is ALOT of time to get much done… don’t worry about price the retail price drops 50-70% on anything xbox,ps3,lcds,iphones,ipods as fast as only 1 year went by.

Also computers in 20 years will be using quantum based processer which will calculate in not only 1010101 but maybe even 01020102s etc… a whole new bit number. Which will automatically make it millions times faster then anything you run right now…

With that in mind webbrowsers will be replaced with something much different hard to say what I have no idea but maybe voice activated, electrical mind scan searching widgets. The mind scanning method could be reality soon.
Since like 5 months ago they decoded the complete DNA of many humans and including human dna you could access this on the net somewhere seen it on CBS news.

Sure the old stuff will exist it always does… but who will be using it? doubt anyone unless they are very commited to this forum.

Anyways it’s all speculation anyways but whats really stopping it from coming here. A bit of trial and error, thinking and time and its done.

As for the flying cars the some peepz was planning on using static generator using energy of space to from what I understand collect protons in one location and electrons in another then using some weird shit to create lift but it was all rejected/denied/disclosed/classified by the government blahblah.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:55, topic:186942”]Who was it who posted about the electronic contact lens. Whoever it was, they got a peek into the future. I wouldn’t doubt there being a new innovation, like a biological web browser, or some super portable computer.

As for flying cars, that’s not such a far off idea anymore. There have been many prototypes for hovercraft’s, personal helicopters, and other things of the sort. That exceed anything the US military uses publicly. All of these prototypes using cost effective materials, and efficient production lines. The only thing missing, is the wise business men/women to invest time and money in such ventures.[/quote]
Hovercraft have been around longer than cars. I built a crude on a few years ago, with much success on a budget [it was not very portable, though].

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Who was it who posted about the electronic contact lens. Whoever it was, they got a peek into the future. I wouldn’t doubt there being a new innovation, like a biological web browser, or some super portable computer.

As for flying cars, that’s not such a far off idea anymore. There have been many prototypes for hovercraft’s, personal helicopters, and other things of the sort. That exceed anything the US military uses publicly. All of these prototypes using cost effective materials, and efficient production lines. The only thing missing, is the wise business men/women to invest time and money in such ventures.

item.title: Mitb/Mscp in 20 years
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:30, topic:186942”][quote author=Rajae link=topic=249474.msg2101309#msg2101309 date=1205196156]
The front page of Moparisthebest.com will remain exactly the same.
[/quote]

Haha, most likely. (no, I’ll change it one day)

I will be around in 20 years. This site may or may not be around, obviously to still exist it would have to change with the times, probably different software, maybe even a different focus. 20 years is a long time to look forward, especially on an internet that hasn’t even been around for 20 years yet. I will certainly always remember the forums though, how could I forget? :D[/quote]

I think Mitb will be focused on how it’s going to be in the next 20 years… in 20 years.
